ICYMI: We are still registering students for Kindergarten Launch Academy!

1) KLA is for our youngest learners who turn 5 between May 1 and September 30 to give them the gift of time and deeper foundation of early math and reading skills and with an emphasis on building social emotional skills through exploration, play, literacy, and fun!

2) KLA will be using Kindergarten standards but at a more intentional and individualized pace.

3) KLA has a different English Language Arts and Math curriculum than traditional kindergarten. Activities are developmentally appropriate with using manipulatives, movement, music and literature. This will be part of remote learning.

4) KLA will be using the Second Step program for social emotional learning that includes problem solving, empathy and skills for learning.

5) KLA will follow the same distance learning schedule as traditional kindergarten students.

Learn more about KLA here: https://www.parmacityschools.org/Page/1964

We are grateful to Governor DeWine for providing clarity this afternoon regarding the opening of schools for the 2020-21 academic year. We are extremely excited by the prospect of again greeting our students in person, instead of virtually! We had already begun planning efforts based upon both surveys parents completed earlier this summer and the input of our professional staff, but it is extremely helpful to these efforts to now understand the Governor's requirements. In the coming days, we will work to refine our plans and anticipate finalizing them in time for presentation to the Board of Education at their July 16 meeting.

In the interim, we ask parents to please help us in reinforcing to their children the importance of wearing face coverings. Given today's message from Governor DeWine, face coverings will now become a staple of our approach to providing a safe environment for our students, particularly in our secondary schools.

We look forward to providing further information in the coming weeks and hope that you and your family are having a happy and healthy summer!

Charlie

Wednesday, April 8, 2020 -- 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM
Thursday, April 9, 2020 -- 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM

*PLEASE NOTE THE FRIDAY PICK UP HAS BEEN MOVED TO THURSDAY THIS WEEK. IF YOU HAVE BEEN PICKING UP ON FRIDAYS, YOU WILL PICK UP ON THURSDAY THIS WEEK.*

Families MUST complete the sign up that corresponds to the date they would like to pick up meals. FAMILIES ARE ALLOWED TO PICK UP MEALS ONCE PER WEEK ONLY. Meals are for children 18 and younger. Each child will receive 7 breakfasts and 7 lunches. Once the maximum limit has been reached, the survey will shut down.
